title: Using Geologic Features to Visualize Long-Term Changes in Urban Forest Structure and Composition: Thain Family Forest of the New York Botanical Garden, Bronx, New York
content: As one of the largest and oldest cities in the United States (NYC Landmarks Preservation Commission 2023; United States Census Bureau 2022, 2023), New York City (NYC) provides an ideal case study to examine urban forest change. The 20 ha Thain Family Forest located in Bronx, New York, has been a continuously closed canopy forest since precolonial times with no evidence of land clearing (Britton 1906; Loeb 2011; Moore 1923; Mulally 1887; Rudnicky & McDonnell 1989; Schuler and Forrest 2016) and has been stewarded by the New York Botanical Garden (NYBG) since 1895.
